title: 112_hr2127
content: The Act is titled the "Nationally Enhancing the Wellbeing of Babies through Outreach and Research Now Act" or the "NEWBORN Act." It includes provisions for Infant Mortality Pilot Programs. Section 330H of the Public Health Service Act is amended to include Infant Mortality Pilot Programs. Grants will be awarded to eligible entities to create, implement, and oversee these programs for a period of 5 consecutive fiscal years. Preference will be given to entities serving counties with the highest rates of infant mortality in the past 3 years. The Infant Mortality Pilot Program funded under Section 330H of the Public Health Service Act may include developing individual community plans, providing outreach to at-risk mothers, and implementing systems for improved access to services promoting healthy pregnancies and infant care. The Infant Mortality Pilot Program may include postpartum care, prevention of premature delivery, counseling for at-risk mothers, rural outreach, public education campaigns to prevent preterm births. The Infant Mortality Pilot Program aims to prevent preterm births, educate the public about infant mortality, provide additional activities as needed, and coordinate efforts between health departments and existing entities working to reduce infant mortality rates. The Infant Mortality Pilot Program requires eligible entities to limit program evaluation spending to 10%. Entities must submit annual reports detailing their pilot program methodology, outcomes, and statistics to the Secretary for evaluation. The Infant Mortality Pilot Program requires eligible entities to submit reports for evaluation and statistical research on funded programs. Definitions for terms like Administrator, eligible entity, and tribal are provided. The Infant Mortality Pilot Program authorizes $10,000,000 for fiscal years 2012 for infant mortality pilot programs. The Infant Mortality Pilot Program authorizes $10,000,000 for fiscal years 2012 through 2016 to carry out subsection (e) in addition to the Healthy Start Initiative funding.
